meanings.definition: A person who has defeated or surpassed all rivals in a competition
meanings.sent1: The young champion proudly held up the trophy.
meanings.sent2: The champion of the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The little champion in the spelling bee spelled 'champion' perfectly.
meanings.sent4: She was a true champion of justice, always standing up for what was right.
meanings.sent5: The champion's victory was celebrated by the whole town.

meanings.definition: To support or defend a cause or person
meanings.sent1: We must champion the rights of all people.
meanings.sent2: She decided to champion the local animal shelter's cause.
meanings.sent3: He championed the idea of having a pizza party every Friday.
meanings.sent4: She champions for the environment by organizing clean-up events.
meanings.sent5: Let's champion this important cause together.

meanings.definition: To fight for or speak in favor of something
meanings.sent1: The group decided to champion the new policy at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She champions for better working conditions for all employees.
meanings.sent3: He championed for the idea of having a longer lunch break.
meanings.sent4: She champions for equality in education for all children.
meanings.sent5: Let's champion this positive change in our community.
